title: 820-4924-a backlight
message: Liquid damaged board.  I cleaned it out, but the blacklight will randomly start flickering.  It maybe does it for 30-60 seconds an hour.  Don't know where to start.

title: 820-4924-a backlight
message: Check corrosion around U7700 and LCD connector. Make sure the LCD is known good too.

title: 820-4924-a backlight
message: I changed the LCD still same issue.  I don't have a schematic for this logic board.  Where is the U7700?  There was no corrosion near lcd connector.  Only on the back around thunderbolt connections.

title: 820-4924-a backlight
message: Did you use an LCD assembly for 2015 model, only those will work. Schematic can be found with Google.

title: 820-4924-a backlight
message:
Yes I used my shops macbook lcd (which is a 2015). I was hoping to save the $20 to buy the schematic but no worries. I found the u7700, no corrosion around that area.

On a side note: the 2013/2014 lcd works as well.  they are the same lcd for future reference.

title: 820-4924-a backlight
message:
You can find the schematics for free too. 4924 is everywhere if you look. 
Could also be the lid sensor, check corrosion around J5250

title: 820-4924-a backlight
message: J5250 was really pretty corroded. I reflowed that part but it hasn't helped. I'll replace that and let you know.
